newsitem.title: YEMEN: Yemen 91-day treasury bills yield average 26.21pct.
newsitem.headline: Yemen 91-day treasury bills yield average 26.21pct.

text.p: The Central Bank of Yemen said on Wednesday its latest issue of 91-day treasury bills yielded an average of 26.21 percent, down from the average 27.13 percent at the August 10 auction for 91-day bills.
Of the 2.5 billion rials worth of bills on offer, the issue attracted subscriptions worth 2.3 billion rials.
The average price was 9,386.59 rials and the lowest price accepted was 9,380. Yields ranged from 24.20 percent to 26.51 percent.
The latest issue of 182-day bills yielded an average 23.56 percent, down from last month's average 27.62 percent.
Of the 1.5 billion rials worth of 182-day bills on offer, the issue attracted subscriptions worth 1.4 billion rials.
The average price was 8,948.84 rials and the lowest price accepted was 8,810. Yields ranged from 13.37 percent to 27.09 percent.
The Bank said the next auction would be held on October 8.
